title: Quick Start
content: Create a Project acme init my-project cd my-project This generates the following structure: my-project/ ├── acme.toml ├── src/ │ └── main.ac └── tests/ └── main_test.ac Run the Project acme run Your application is now running at http://localhost:4000 . Build for Production acme build --release The optimized binary is output to dist/ .

title: Configuration
content: All project settings live in acme.toml at the root of your project. Minimal Config [project] name = "my-project" version = "0.1.0" [build] target = "release" Configuration Reference Key Type Default Description `project.name` string required Project name `project.version` string `"0.1.0"` Semantic version `build.target` string `"debug"` Build profile `build.output_dir` string `"dist"` Output directory `server.port` integer `4000` Dev server port Environment Variables Override any config value with environment variables: ACME_BUILD_TARGET=release acme build ACME_SERVER_PORT=8080 acme run

title: Installation
content: System Requirements macOS 12+, Ubuntu 20.04+, or Windows 10+ 512 MB RAM minimum 100 MB disk space Install via Package Manager macOS (Homebrew) brew install acme-platform Linux (apt) curl -fsSL https://get.acme.dev | bash sudo apt install acme-cli Windows (Scoop) scoop bucket add acme https://github.com/acme/scoop-bucket scoop install acme-cli Verify Installation acme --version # acme 2.1.0 If the command is not found, ensure the install directory is in your PATH .

title: Working with Data
content: Acme provides built-in database connectors for common databases. Supported Databases Database Status PostgreSQL Stable SQLite Stable MySQL Beta Connection Setup Add a database section to your acme.toml : [database] adapter = "postgresql" host = "localhost" port = 5432 name = "mydb" Running Queries db = Acme.connect() users = db.query("SELECT * FROM users WHERE active = ?", true) for user in users: print(user.name) Migrations acme db migrate acme db rollback acme db status

title: Deployment
content: Build for Production Always build with the release flag before deploying: acme build --release Deploy Options Docker FROM acme/runtime:latest COPY dist/ /app/ EXPOSE 4000 CMD ["/app/my-project"] Build and run: docker build -t my-project . docker run -p 4000:4000 my-project Cloud Platforms Acme supports one-command deploy to popular platforms: acme deploy --target aws acme deploy --target gcp acme deploy --target fly Health Checks The built-in health endpoint is available at /health : curl http://localhost:4000/health # {"status": "ok"}
